title: Enable direct download of UD Probe and UCMDB Local Client from the Service Management UI
content:
The On-Premises Bridge download center provides download links to endpoint resources. In the UCMDB section, there's a link to the software product website, from which you can search for and then download UCMDB installation files, such as the Universal Discovery (UD) Probe and UCMDB Local Client installation files.

If your suite is using the containerized UD/UCMDB, which has the UD Probe and UCMDB Local Client installation files embedded in it, you have the option to replace the product website link with direct download links to these embedded installation files. Clicking each direct download link will trigger an automatic download of the corresponding installation file.

You need to use a script available from the ITOM Marketplace to replace the download link. Additionally, this script allows you to replace the download link for all tenants in one go or only for one tenant at one time.  

Prerequisites

  • Both Service Management and the containerized UD/UCMDB are running. Integration setup between Service Management and UD/UCMDB isn't a prerequisite.
  • You know the password of the bo-integration@dummy.com user. Its initial password is specified during the suite installation.
    If you don't know this password, refer to this topic for how to change or retrieve the password for the system-level integration user.

Replace the UCMDB/Discovery download link

  1. Download the SMA Operation Toolkit from the ITOM Marketplace. Find the enable_download.py script in the enable_download folder.
  2. Copy the script to a temporary directory on a control plane node or the bastion node. 
  3. Run the script: 
    python3 enable_download.py <Service Management Host> '<TenantID>' bo-integration@dummy.com <Password> 'https://<UCMDB_Host>:<Port>/ucmdb-downloader' CMS_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE
    Where:
    • <Service Management Host> is the external access host name of Service Management.
    • <TenantID> is the ID of the target tenant (for example, 604006505). If you omit this parameter, the script will run for all tenants in Service Management. Be sure to enclose the tenant ID in single quotation marks.
    • <Password> is the password of the bo-integration@dummy.com user. 
    • <UCMDB_Host> and<Port> are the external access host name and port of containerized UD/UCMDB, which you can find from its login URL. Be sure to enclose https://<UCMDB_Host>:<Port>/ucmdb-downloader in single quotation marks.

    For example:

    python3 enable_download.py mysmax.mycompany.net '566500008' bo-integration@dummy.com Admin_6486 'https://mycms.mycompany.net:38090/ucmdb-downloader' CMS_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE
  4. Wait until the terminal returns the following message:  
    Updated setting to :https://<UCMDB_Host>:<Port>/ucmdb-downloader.
  5. Verify that the new download links are available:
    1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
    2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration, click Agents on the top of the screen and then select Endpoints from the list.
    3. Verify that the UCMDB section now looks like below:
    4. On the right pane, click the download links and verify that the browser automatically downloads the following files:
      • UCMDB /Universal Discovery:
        • UD_<version>_Probe_Linux.zip
        • UD_<version>_Probe_Windows.zip
      • UCMDB Local Client Tool:
        • UCMDB_Local_Client_Win_<version>.zip
        • UCMDB_Local_Client_Mac_<version>.zip
        • UCMDB_Local_Client_Linux_<version>.zip

How to restore the original download link

If you want to restore the original UCMDB/Universal Discovery download link, run the following command on a control plane mode or the bastion node: 

python3 enable_download.py <Service Management Host> '<TenantID>' bo-integration@dummy.com <password> '' CMS_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE

This command and the earlier command are basically the same, except that this command encloses nothing instead of https://<UCMDB_Host>:<Port>/ucmdb-downloader in a pair of single quotation marks. 

For example:

python3 enable_download.py mysmax.mycompany.net '566500008' bo-integration@dummy.com Admin_6486 '' CMS_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE
